document.heading: Interest Rate Ceiling Amendment Clarification Act of 1985

history.narrative: Law 6-5, the “Interest Rate Ceiling Amendment Clarification Act of 1985,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 6-82, which was referred to the Committee on Finance and Revenue. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on March 12, 1985, and March 26, 1985, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on April 10, 1985, it was assigned Act No. 6-17 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
